pandemic.title: Pandemic Information
pandemic.content:
During a pandemic, it is crucial to follow advice from health authorities (like [Helsenorge.no](https://www.helsenorge.no/) and FHI) to limit the spread of infection.

**Key measures include:**
* Good hand and cough hygiene.
* Maintaining distance from others.
* Staying home when sick.
* Ensuring you have necessary medications and hygiene items readily available.

Be prepared for services such as transportation and shops to be affected. Maintain a stock of food and drink as recommended in the self-preparedness guidelines. Follow official information and be critical of sources.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf)*

war.title: War Information
war.content:
Although Norway is a safe country, it's important to be prepared for various scenarios, including acts of war. In such a situation:

* **Follow authorities' advice closely.** Information will be provided through official channels like NRK P1.
* **Seek information:** Stay updated through reliable sources.
* **Find cover:** Familiarize yourself with the nearest public shelter (check [kart.dsb.no](https://kart.dsb.no)). If none is available, seek cover in basements or central rooms of buildings, away from windows as they can shatter.
* **Have your emergency kit ready:** Ensure you have enough food, water, and other necessities for at least one week.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf)*

flood.title: Flood Information
flood.content:
In case of flood risk:

* **Follow warnings:** Stay updated on weather forecasts from [MET Norway (Yr.no)](https://www.yr.no) and flood warnings from [NVE (varsom.no)](https://www.varsom.no).
* **Secure property:** Fasten or move loose items outdoors. Move valuable possessions and hazardous materials (chemicals, fuel) up from basements and ground floors.
* **Seal openings:** Seal vents and drains to prevent water intrusion.
* **Consider evacuation:** Follow advice from authorities regarding potential evacuation.
* **Avoid floodwaters:** Do not drive, walk, or swim in floodwaters – currents can be strong, and there may be hidden dangers.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf) and [varsom.no](https://www.varsom.no)*

hurricane.title: Hurricane/Severe Storm Information
hurricane.content:
When a hurricane or severe storm is forecast:

* **Follow forecasts:** Stay updated via [MET Norway (Yr.no)](https://www.yr.no).
* **Secure loose items:** Fasten garden furniture, trampolines, bins, and anything else that could be blown away.
* **Stay indoors:** Avoid unnecessary travel. Close windows and doors securely.
* **Prepare for power outages:** Have flashlights, a battery-powered radio, a charged power bank, and any alternative heat source ready. Ensure you have sufficient food and water.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf)*

drought.title: Drought Information
drought.content:
During prolonged drought periods:

* **Conserve water:** Follow any water usage restrictions issued by your municipality. Limit watering lawns/gardens, washing cars, etc.
* **Check for fire bans:** Drought increases fire risk. Be aware of and adhere to all fire restrictions.
* **Monitor water sources:** If you rely on private wells, monitor water levels.

*[Source: Relevant Municipal/NVE information]*

heatwave.title: Heatwave Information
heatwave.content:
During extreme heat:

* **Stay hydrated:** Drink plenty of water, even if you don't feel thirsty.
* **Keep cool:** Stay indoors in cool places during the hottest parts of the day. Use fans or air conditioning if available. Take cool showers or baths.
* **Check on vulnerable people:** Look out for elderly neighbors, infants, and those with chronic health conditions.
* **Never leave children or pets in parked cars.**

*[Source: Helsenorge.no]*

forestFire.title: Forest Fire Information
forestFire.content:
To prevent and manage forest fire risks:

* **Respect fire bans:** Check local regulations and the general fire ban period (April 15 - September 15). Be extremely cautious with any open flame.
* **Check danger levels:** Stay updated on [skogbrannfare.met.no](https://skogbrannfare.met.no).
* **Have an evacuation plan:** If you live in an area at risk, plan where you can go and what you need to take.
* **Stay informed:** Follow information from local authorities and the fire department.
* **Protect your home:** Close windows and vents to prevent smoke from entering. Remove flammable materials from near the house walls.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf) and [DSB - Forest Fire](https://www.dsb.no/brannsikkerhet/brannberedskap/skogbrann/)*

powerOutage.title: Power Outage Information
powerOutage.content:
During a power outage:

* **Use alternative light sources:** Flashlights, battery-powered lamps, or glow sticks are safer than candles.
* **Keep refrigerator/freezer closed:** A full freezer will keep food frozen for about 48 hours if unopened.
* **Stay warm:** Dress in layers. Close off unused rooms. Use safe alternative heating methods if available.
* **Conserve phone battery:** Use your phone sparingly. Consider having a power bank charged and ready.
* **Be careful with generators:** If using a generator, follow all safety instructions and never operate it indoors.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf)*

waterShortage.title: Water Shortage Information
waterShortage.content:
In case of water shortage or contamination:

* **Follow official advice:** Authorities may issue boil water advisories or other instructions.
* **Use emergency water supplies:** Use stored water or other safe sources for drinking, cooking, and hygiene.
* **Conserve water:** Minimize usage for non-essential purposes.
* **Know how to purify water:** Be familiar with methods like boiling, using water purification tablets, or filtering.

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf)*

cyberAttack.title: Cyber Attack Information
cyberAttack.content:
To protect yourself from cyber threats:

* **Use strong, unique passwords:** Create different passwords for important accounts.
* **Enable two-factor authentication:** This adds an extra layer of security.
* **Be cautious with emails and links:** Don't click on suspicious links or download attachments from unknown sources.
* **Keep software updated:** Install updates promptly to patch security vulnerabilities.
* **Back up important data:** Regularly back up important files to an external device or secure cloud service.

*[Source: National Security Authority (NSM)](https://www.nsm.no/)*

majorAccident.title: Major Accident Information
majorAccident.content:
In case of a major accident (industrial, transportation, etc.):

* **Follow evacuation orders:** If authorities instruct you to evacuate, do so immediately.
* **Shelter in place if directed:** If told to stay indoors, close windows and doors, turn off ventilation systems, and move to an interior room if possible.
* **Stay informed:** Listen to local radio or check official websites for instructions.
* **Avoid the affected area:** Keep roads clear for emergency vehicles.

*[Source: DSB](https://www.dsb.no/)*

preparednessStorage.title: Preparedness Storage
preparednessStorage.content:
The Norwegian Directorate for Civil Protection (DSB) recommends that all households be self-sufficient for at least three days. Your emergency preparedness storage should include:

**Food and Drink:**
* Nine liters of water per person
* Non-perishable food that can be eaten without preparation or with minimal heating

**Medications and Hygiene:**
* Necessary prescription medications
* Pain relievers and other basic medicines
* First aid kit
* Hygiene products
* Wet wipes and disinfectant

**Heat and Light Sources:**
* Flashlights with extra batteries
* Candles, matches/lighter
* Warm clothes, blankets, sleeping bags
* Alternative heating source (if possible)

**Other Important Items:**
* Battery-powered or hand-crank radio
* Extra batteries/power banks for mobile phones
* Cash in small denominations
* Fuel in the car
* Paper copies of important documents
* Basic tools

*[Source: DSB - Self-Preparedness](https://www.dsb.no/siteassets/sikkerhverdag/egenberedskap/brosjyren/dsb-egenberedskap-bokmal-uu-web_ny.pdf)*

afterCrisis.title: After a Crisis
afterCrisis.content:
After experiencing a crisis:

**Take care of immediate needs:**
* Ensure your safety and the safety of those around you
* Seek medical attention if needed
* Find safe shelter if your home is damaged
* Contact family members to let them know you're safe

**Begin recovery:**
* Document damage (take photos) for insurance purposes
* Contact your insurance company
* Apply for disaster assistance if available
* Clean and repair your home when it's safe to do so

**Mental health is important:**
* It's normal to experience stress, anxiety, or other emotional reactions
* Talk about your experiences with family, friends, or professionals
* Take care of your physical health (sleep, nutrition, exercise)
* Seek professional help if needed

**Learn from the experience:**
* Evaluate your emergency plan and supplies
* Make improvements based on what you learned
* Help others in your community

*[Source: Helsenorge.no and DSB](https://www.dsb.no/)*
